intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. galbeum, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features basal rosettes of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a common weed in agricultural and urban environments.
